stance_1: I am concerned about environmental impact of beef
stance_2: I have reduced my meat consumption
justification: The interviewee explicitly connects environmental concerns about beef and the reduction of meat consumption, even if it is not the primary motivator.

stance_1: I am concerned about environmental impact of beef
stance_2: People in my community generally do not eat red meat
justification: The interviewee notes that many in the community are motivated by environmental concerns to avoid beef, showing explicit support between these stances.

stance_1: I do not miss eating meat
stance_2: I eat mushrooms as a meat substitute
justification: The interviewee explicitly mentions mushrooms satisfy the desire for meat, leading to not missing meat.

stance_1: I do not miss eating meat
stance_2: I have reduced my meat consumption
justification: The interviewee states they do not miss meat after reducing consumption, showing support between these stances.

stance_1: I eat a lot of fish and chicken
stance_2: I get protein from fish, chicken, and vegetables
justification: The interviewee explicitly states reliance on fish, chicken, and vegetables for protein.

stance_1: I eat mushrooms as a meat substitute
stance_2: I have reduced my meat consumption
justification: Using mushrooms as a substitute supports the reduction in meat consumption.

stance_1: I get protein from fish, chicken, and vegetables
stance_2: I have reduced my meat consumption
justification: The ability to get protein from non-red meat sources supports reduced meat consumption.

stance_1: I have reduced my meat consumption
stance_2: My friends are copious meat eaters
justification: The interviewee contrasts their own reduced consumption with friends who eat a lot of meat.

stance_1: I have reduced my meat consumption
stance_2: People in my community generally do not eat red meat
justification: Both the interviewee and their community have reduced red meat consumption; the community supports the individual's choice.

stance_1: I want to eat natural and organic foods
stance_2: I have reduced my meat consumption
justification: The desire to eat natural and organic foods may implicitly support reduced meat consumption, though the link is not strongly stated.

stance_1: My community has good vegetarian and vegan options
stance_2: People in my community generally do not eat red meat
justification: Good vegetarian and vegan options make it easier for the community to avoid red meat.
